docs.title: How to Setup a Blog with GitHub Pages and mkdocs material
docs.text:
This blog is setup with mkdocs and mkdocs-material.

I mostly just follow the mkdocs material instructions on setting up a blog and publishing to GitHub pages using GitHub Actions. But, I had to make some tweeks to get it to work. I explain below.

docs.title: Pipenv
docs.text:
I use pipenv to manage the dependencies. This means that I have a Pipfile and Pipfile.lock in the root of the project.

I found that only version 9.2 of mkdocs-material implements blogs, and that version is still in beta. So, to get pipenv to install the beta version we have put the following in the Pipfile:

[packages]
mkdocs = "*"
mkdocs-material = ">=9.2.0b2"

docs.title: GitHub Workflow
docs.text:
To get the GitHub workflow to use pipenv, I change the workflow run statement to:

      - run: pip install pipenv
- run: pipenv install --deploy --dev
- run: pipenv run mkdocs gh-deploy --force

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text:
It works!

Because the the GitHub Actions update the blog automatically on commit, this means that I can update this website from github.com itself. Cool!
